title: Invasion of Poland
description: The invasion of Poland by Germany on **September 1, 1939**, marked the beginning of World War II.

title: German invasion of France and the Low Countries
description: On **May 10, 1940**, Germany launched a blitzkrieg against France, Belgium, and the Netherlands.

title: Operation Barbarossa
description: The German invasion of the Soviet Union began on **June 22, 1941**, and was the largest military operation in history.

title: Attack on Pearl Harbor
description: On **December 7, 1941**, Japan attacked the US naval base at Pearl Harbor, prompting the US to enter World War II.

title: Battle of Midway
description: Fought between **June 4 and June 7, 1942**, this decisive naval battle marked a turning point in the Pacific War.

title: D-Day (Normandy landings)
description: On **June 6, 1944**, Allied forces landed on the beaches of Normandy, France, beginning the liberation of Western Europe.

title: Toto
description: This is a placeholder event with timestamps corresponding to **D-Day** and the **German invasion of France**.

title: Liberation of Auschwitz
description: On **January 27, 1945**, Soviet forces liberated the Auschwitz concentration camp, revealing the horrors of the Holocaust.

title: Victory in Europe Day (VE Day)
description: Celebrated on **May 8, 1945**, this day marks the unconditional surrender of Nazi Germany to the Allies.

title: Atomic bombing of Hiroshima
description: On **August 6, 1945**, the US dropped an atomic bomb on Hiroshima, Japan, leading to immense destruction and loss of life.

title: Surrender of Japan (End of WWII)
description: On **September 2, 1945**, Japan formally surrendered, bringing an end to World War II.
